project_description: A simple Flutter application using the Cubit pattern for state management. The app includes a login screen with email and password fields, and a home screen with a logout button.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular structure with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets. State management is handled using the Cubit pattern.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: The entry point of the application. Provides all the necessary Cubits using BlocProvider.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The main function that runs the app.

files.name: lib/cubits/auth_cubit.dart
files.description: Handles the authentication state of the application.

files.name: lib/screens/home_screen.dart
files.description: The home screen of the application.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree for the home screen.

files.name: lib/screens/login_screen.dart
files.description: The login screen of the application.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree for the login screen.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree for the login form.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree for the logout button.

widgets.name: HomeScreen
widgets.description: The home screen of the application.

widgets.name: LoginScreen
widgets.description: The login screen of the application.

cubits.name: AuthCubit
cubits.description: Handles the authentication state of the application.

dependencies.name: bloc_test
dependencies.purpose: Utilities for testing blocs and cubits.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> LoginScreen: opens
LoginScreen -> AuthCubit: login(email, password)
AuthCubit -> AuthState: update state
AuthCubit -> HomeScreen: navigate
HomeScreen -> AuthCubit: logout
AuthCubit -> AuthState: update state
AuthCubit -> LoginScreen: navigate
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. When the user interacts with the login form, the login method in AuthCubit is called, which updates the AuthState. The HomeScreen listens to AuthCubit and displays the appropriate UI based on the state. The logout button triggers the logout method in AuthCubit, which updates the AuthState and navigates the user back to the LoginScreen.
navigation_flow: The app starts with the LoginScreen. Upon successful login, the user is navigated to the HomeScreen. The HomeScreen contains a logout button that, when pressed, navigates the user back to the LoginScreen.

pubspec_yaml.name: simple_cubit_app
pubspec_yaml.description: A simple Flutter application using the Cubit pattern for state management.
